title: Did the C.E.O. for gravity payments, Dan Price, have to rent his house to make the end meet?
subtitle: The CEO of gravity payments Dan Price rented his house after raising his company's minimum wage to $70,000, but not because he couldn't make up for it.
author: Dan Evon
vclaim: The Executive Director of gravity payments (Dan Price) rented his home to cover his expenses after deducting $90,000 and raising the minimum wage in his company to $70,000.
